## V2modelsBotVersion Resource Properties {#properties}

To learn more about resource properties and how to use them, see [Inputs and Outputs](/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs) in the Architecture and Concepts docs.

### Inputs

<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="python">
<p>
In Python, inputs that are objects can be passed either as <a href="/docs/languages-sdks/python/#inputs-and-outputs">argument classes or as dictionary literals</a>.
</p>
</pulumi-choosable>

The V2modelsBotVersion resource accepts the following [input](/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs) properties:



<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="botid_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#botid_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Bot<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Idientifier of the bot to create the version for.</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="localespecification_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#localespecification_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Locale<wbr>Specification</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Dictionary&lt;string, V2models<wbr>Bot<wbr>Version<wbr>Locale<wbr>Specification<wbr>Args&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the locales that Amazon Lex adds to this version. You can choose the draft version or any other previously published version for each locale. When you specify a source version, the locale data is copied from the source version to the new version.</p>
<p>The attribute value is a map with one or more entries, each of which has a locale name as the key and an object with the following attribute as the value:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>sourceBotVersion</code> - (Required) The version of a bot used for a bot locale. Valid values: <code>DRAFT</code>, a numeric version.</li>
</ul>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="botversion_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#botversion_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Bot<wbr>Version</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Version number assigned to the version.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="description_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#description_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Description</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>A description of the version. Use the description to help identify the version in lists.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="timeouts_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#timeouts_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Timeouts</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#v2modelsbotversiontimeouts">V2models<wbr>Bot<wbr>Version<wbr>Timeouts</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd></dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="go">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="botid_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#botid_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Bot<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Idientifier of the bot to create the version for.</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="localespecification_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#localespecification_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Locale<wbr>Specification</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">map[string]V2models<wbr>Bot<wbr>Version<wbr>Locale<wbr>Specification<wbr>Args</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the locales that Amazon Lex adds to this version. You can choose the draft version or any other previously published version for each locale. When you specify a source version, the locale data is copied from the source version to the new version.</p>
<p>The attribute value is a map with one or more entries, each of which has a locale name as the key and an object with the following attribute as the value:</p>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import Lex V2 Models Bot Version using the `id`. For example:

```sh
$ pulumi import aws:lex/v2modelsBotVersion:V2modelsBotVersion example id-12345678,1
```


To learn more about importing existing cloud resources, see [Importing resources](/docs/using-pulumi/adopting-pulumi/import/).
